topic.title: Setting a system property for the Web-Based Editor

keywords.indexterm: Content Fusion Enterprise - set System Property

body.p: A variety of Java system properties can be set to influence the behavior of web-based editor embedded in Content Fusion.

For example, the following code in the /fusion/docker-compose.override.yml file would set the system property called property.name to the value value: webauthor: environment: - OXYGEN_JAVA_OTPS=-Xmx3072M -Dproperty.name=value
body.note: The -Xmx3072M configuration represents the memory size limit configured for the web-based editor. This is the default value, and you can change it according to your usage.
The indentation is required in the YML file.
body.p: After modifying this configuration, you need to restart the web-based editor by running the following command in the /fusion directory:docker-compose up -d --force-recreate webauthor
